movie_title: The Birth of China - The Dawn of Inequality (5000 to 3000 BCE)
introduction: In the third episode of our series examining China's earliest societies, we explore the increasingly

vocabulary.example: The flourishing settlement along the Yellow River showed signs of prosperity and growth.

vocabulary.definition: believing in or based on the principle that all people are equal and deserve equal rights and opportunities
vocabulary.example: The early Neolithic society demonstrated egalitarian values where everyone had equal access to resources.

vocabulary.definition: related to an organization or establishment created for a specific purpose
vocabulary.example: The development of new institutional roles marked the shift towards a more complex society.

vocabulary.definition: a religious or solemn ceremony consisting of a series of actions performed according to a prescribed order
vocabulary.example: The communal activities at the ritual site were conducted with great reverence and tradition.

vocabulary.definition: a system in which members of an organization or society are ranked according to relative status or authority
vocabulary.example: The social hierarchy within the community determined the distribution of resources and power.

vocabulary.definition: relating to the branch of philosophy dealing with the origin and structure of the universe
vocabulary.example: The turtle shell artifact was believed to have cosmological significance in the ancient culture's beliefs.
